fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models

Class CoupledModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.Model
      • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.CoupledModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    VariableDefinitionsAndSharingI, VariableInitialisationI, CoupledModelI, ModelI, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    BankCoupledModel, BasicCounterCoupledModel, HIOA_CoupledModel, MoleneModel, PortableComputerModel, SSQueueCoupledES_Model, ThermostatCoupledModel, WiFiModel

    public abstract class CoupledModel
extends Model
implements CoupledModelI
    The class CoupledModel implements the most general methods and instance variables for DEVS coupled models.

    Description

    The class implement a polymorphic coordination algorithm able to take into account the three kinds of atomic simulation models implemented in the library i.e., standard DEVS atomic models, event scheduling view (ES) atomic models and hybrid system models inspired from Lynch et al. hybrid input/output automata (HIOA) and timed input/output automata (TIOA). Hence, it is meant to be used as the base class of any user defined coupled model. However, the library may include in the future other implementations of coupled models including the coordination of other types of simulation models of providing specialised and more efficient coordination algorithms for specific subsets of types of simulation models or even coordination algorithm tailored to homogeneous sets of submodels of the same type.

    As coordination is concerned, event scheduling view atomic models needs nothing more than what is already required to coordinate standard DEVS atomic models. Both exchanges external events exported by some models and imported by others. When creating a coupled model, it is therefore required to define the connections among the submodels. it is also required to define the events that are imported by the coupled model, the submodels that consume them and, when necessary, how to convert a coupled model imported event into the type of events imported by each consuming submodel. Finally, it is also required to define the events that are exported by the submodels and reexported by the coupled model. Because the type of event exported by the coupled model need not be the same as the one exported by the submodel, a conversion function can also be defined.

    HIOA atomic models add a very different aspect to the standard DEVS atomic models as they are defined over continuous and discrete variables that may be exported and imported among them. In a manner similar to the events, a coupled model must define its imported variables and the submodels that consume them, its exported variables and the submodels that export them and the internal bindings of variables exported by a submodel and imported by other submodels.

    Besides the management of variables, HIOA models introduce a much tighter coupling between models that share variables. At initialisation time, the order through which variables are evaluated needs to follow their export/import dependencies, exported variables being initialised before their bound imported ones can be used to further initialise other internal or exported variables which need them to be computed. Hence, HIOA models need a finer initialisation protocol for the variables. I n fact, two protocols are proposed:

    1. An unordered protocol using the method initialiseVariables in which models can be initialised in any particular order because no dependency exists among their variables.
    2. A fix point protocol using the method fixpointInitialiseVariables in which this method is called repeatedly on all models until all variables in all models have been initialised.

    The choice between the two protocols is controlled by the method useFixpointInitialiseVariables returning false by default. Each atomic model can redefine this method to say that it uses the fix point protocol (to be coherent, at least two models in a simulation architecture must use the protocol). Coupled models detect this use by looking at all of the descendant atomic models. Mixing models that use the simple protocol and the fix point one is possible. In this case, the method initialiseVariables will be called first on models not using the fix point protocol and then the fix point protocol is applied.

    White-box Invariant

     invariant       submodels != null && submodels.length > 1
 invariant       submodel2index != null && submodel2index.size() == submodels.length
 invariant       submodelURIs != null && submodelURIs.length == submodels.length && Stream.of(submodelURIs).allMatch(uri -> uri != null && !uri.isEmpty() && isSubmodel(uri))
 invariant       submodelURI2index != null && submodelURI2index.size() == submodels.length && submodelURI2index.keySet().stream().allMatch(uri -> isSubmodel(uri)) && submodelURI2index.values().stream().allMatch(i -> i >= 0 && i < submodels.length)
 invariant       imported2sinks != null && imported2sinks.size() <= importedEventTypes.length && e -> isImportedEventType(e.getKey()) && Stream.of(e.getValue()).allMatch(sink -> isSubmodel(sink.importingModelURI) && submodels[submodelURI2index.get(sink.importingModelURI)].isImportedEventType(sink.sinkEventType) && sink.sourceEventType.equals(e.getKey())))
 invariant       exported2reexported != null && exported2reexported.entrySet().stream().allMatch(e -> isSubmodel(e.getValue().exportingModelURI) && submodels[submodelURI2index.get(e.getValue().exportingModelURI)].isExportedEventType(e.getKey()) && isExportedEventType(e.getValue().sinkEventType))
 invariant       instance.internalConnections.entrySet().stream().allMatch(e -> instance.isSubmodel(e.getKey().exportingModelURI) && instance.submodels[instance.submodelURI2index.get(e.getKey().exportingModelURI)].isExportedEventType(e.getKey().sourceEventType) && Stream.of(e.getValue()).allMatch(sink -> instance.isSubmodel(sink.importingModelURI) && instance.submodels[instance.submodelURI2index.get(sink.importingModelURI)].isImportedEventType(sink.sinkEventType)))
 invariant       importedVars2sinks.entrySet().stream().allMatch(e -> e.getKey().getVisibility().equals(VariableVisibility.IMPORTED) && isImportedVariable(e.getKey().getName(), e.getKey().getType()) && Stream.of(e.getValue()).allMatch(sink -> sink.importedVariableName.equals(e.getKey().getName()) && sink.importedVariableType.equals(e.getKey().getType()) && sink.sinkVariableType.isAssignableFrom(e.getKey().getType()) && isSubmodel(sink.sinkModelURI) && submodels[submodelURI2index.get(sink.sinkModelURI)].isImportedVariable(sink.sinkVariableName, sink.sinkVariableType)))
 invariant       exportedVars2reexported.entrySet().stream().allMatch(e -> isSubmodel(e.getKey().exportingModelURI) && submodels[instance.submodelURI2index.get(e.getKey().exportingModelURI)].isExportedVariable(e.getKey().name, e.getKey().type) && isExportedVariable(e.getValue().getName(), e.getValue().getType()) && e.getValue().getType().isAssignableFrom(e.getKey().type))
 invariant       internalBindings.entrySet().stream().allMatch(e -> submodels[submodelURI2index.get(e.getKey().exportingModelURI)].isExportedVariable(e.getKey().name,e.getKey().type) && Stream.of(e.getValue()).allMatch(sink -> submodels[submodelURI2index.get(sink.sinkModelURI)].isImportedVariable(sink.sinkVariableName, sink.sinkVariableType) && sink.sinkVariableType.isAssignableFrom(e.getKey().type)))

    Black-box Invariant

     invariant       true        // no more invariant

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.util.Set<ModelI> activeSubmodels
      Set of submodels that have external events waiting to be executed during the current simulation step.
      protected Duration[] elapsedTimes
      Elapsed times of submodels since their last internal event (i.e., currentStateTime; conceptually, the time of the last internal event plus the elapsed time corresponds to the current global simulation time.
      protected java.util.Map<java.lang.Class<? extends EventI>,ReexportedEvent> exported2reexported
      Map from event types exported by direct submodels to the way they are reexported by this coupled model.
      protected StaticVariableDescriptor[] exportedVariables
      description of the variables exported by this model.
      protected java.util.Map<VariableSource,StaticVariableDescriptor> exportedVars2reexported
      map from description of variables exported by submodels that are reexported by this coupled model.
      protected java.util.Map<java.lang.Class<? extends EventI>,EventSink[]> imported2sinks
      Map from imported event types to direct submodels consuming them.
      protected StaticVariableDescriptor[] importedVariables
      description of the variables imported by this model.
      protected java.util.Map<StaticVariableDescriptor,VariableSink[]> importedVars2sinks
      map from imported variable descriptions to the submodels and their own imported variables that will consume them.
      protected java.util.Map<VariableSource,VariableSink[]> internalBindings
      bindings of variables exported by submodels to imported ones by other submodels.
      protected java.util.Map<EventSource,EventSink[]> internalConnections
      Internal connections from source submodels to sets of sinks submodels.
      protected java.util.Random randomGenerator
      Random number generator used to break the ties when several submodels can perform an internal transition at the same time of next internal transition simulation time.
      private static long serialVersionUID 
      protected java.util.Map<ModelI,java.lang.Integer> submodel2index
      Inverted index to get the indexes for models in the array of submodels.
      protected ModelI submodelOfNextEvent
      The submodel that will need to execute the next event.
      protected ModelI[] submodels
      Submodels of this coupled model.
      protected java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> submodelURI2index
      Inverted index to get the indexes for URIs of models in the array of submodels.
      protected java.lang.String[] submodelURIs
      URIs of submodels of this coupled model.

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addInfluencees(java.lang.String modelURI, java.lang.Class<? extends EventI> ce, java.util.Set<CallableEventAtomicSink> influencees)
      add the given influencees (models that import events exported by this model) to the ones of the given model during in a composition.
      boolean allModelVariablesInitialised()
      return true if all model variables are fully initialised (relevant for HIOA models).
      boolean allModelVariablesTimeInitialised()
      return true if all model variables have their associated time initialised (relevant for HIOA models).
      boolean areInfluencedThrough(java.lang.String modelURI, java.util.Set<java.lang.String> destinationModelURIs, java.lang.Class<? extends EventI> ce)
      return true if all of the models with the given URIs are influenced by this model through the exported events of the class ce in the current composition; this method should be called after composing the model as it tests for models importing events that are exported by this model modulo a translation.
      protected static boolean blackBoxInvariants(CoupledModel instance)
      return true if the black-box invariants are observed, false otherwise.
      void externalTransition(Duration elapsedTime)
      do the next external transition, both calling the method userDefinedExternalTransition and doing all of the necessary internal catering work.
      Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> fixpointInitialiseVariables()
      initialise the model variables with a more elaborated protocol when external model variables depend of each others, hence models importing variables have to wait until these variables are themselves initialised so this protocol will allow to call repetitively the method until all variables are initialised without having to respect any order among models (but models cannot have circular dependencies); this method must be called after the method initialiseState.
      ModelI gatewayTo(java.lang.String modelURI)
      return the reference to a submodel which URI is modelURI or that is the ancestor of the model with modelURI.
      Value<?> getActualExportedVariableValueReference(java.lang.String modelURI, java.lang.String sourceVariableName, java.lang.Class<?> sourceVariableType)
      search among descendant HIOA of the model with URI modelURI the atomic one that defines the designated variable or its alias and return the reference to the placeholder for its value.
      AtomicModel getAtomicDescendantReference(java.lang.String modelURI)
      return the reference to the model object with modelURI.
      java.util.Set<CallableEventAtomicSink> getEventAtomicSinks(java.lang.Class<? extends EventI> ce)
      return the set of atomic event sinks (description of an importing model) for the given event type.
      EventAtomicSource getEventAtomicSource(java.lang.Class<? extends EventI> ce)
      return the atomic event source (description of an exporting model) for the given exported event type.
      StaticVariableDescriptor[] getExportedVariables()
      return the variables exported by this HIOA.
      SimulationReportI getFinalReport()
      return the simulation report of the last simulation run.
      StaticVariableDescriptor[] getImportedVariables()
      return the variables imported by this HIOA.
      EventsExchangingI getInfluenceeReference(java.lang.String modelURI)
      return the reference to the atomic model which URI is modelURI.
      java.util.Set<CallableEventAtomicSink> getInfluencees(java.lang.String modelURI, java.lang.Class<? extends EventI> ce)
      return the set of URIs of models that are influenced by this model through the given type of events.
      protected ModelI getSubmodel(int i)
      get the submodel at index i, returning it as implementing the interface ModelI rather than the declared ModelDescriptionI.
      protected static boolean glassBoxInvariants(CoupledModel instance)
      return true if the glass-box invariants are observed, false otherwise.
      void initialiseState(Time initialTime)
      initialise the state of the model to make it ready to execute a simulation run.
      void initialiseVariables()
      initialise the model variables with a simple protocol when external model variables are fully independent of each others, hence each model can initialise them in any order; this method must be called after the method initialiseState.
      void internalTransition()
      perform the next internal transition, both calling the method userDefinedInternalTransition and doing all of the necessary internal catering work.
      boolean isCoordinated()
      return true if the simulation engine is coordinated by a parent.
      boolean isDescendant(java.lang.String uri)
      return true if uri is the URI of a descendant model of this (coupled) model.
      boolean isExportedVariable(java.lang.String name, java.lang.Class<?> type)
      return true if this model exports the designated variable.
      boolean isImportedVariable(java.lang.String name, java.lang.Class<?> type)
      return true if this model imports the designated variable.
      boolean isInfluencedThrough(java.lang.String modelURI, java.lang.String destinationModelURI, java.lang.Class<? extends EventI> ce)
      return true if the given model is influenced by this model through the events of the class ce in the current composition; this method should be called after composing the model as it tests for models importing events that are exported by this model modulo a translation.
      boolean isStateInitialised()
      return true if the model is initialised and ready to start a simulation run.
      boolean isSubmodel(java.lang.String uri)
      return true if uri is the URI of a submodel of this coupled model.
      boolean isTIOA()
      return true if the HIOA model is a TIOA i.e., has no exported or imported variables (TIOA imports and exports only events).
      protected void modelContentAsString(java.lang.String indent, java.lang.StringBuffer sb)
      produce a string representation the model content with the given indentation (perhaps with several lines) in the given string buffer.
      protected Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> onceFixpointInitialiseVariables()
      compute one run of the fixpoint algorithm to initialise the model variables.
      void produceOutput(Time current)
      If the submodel of next event is among the HIOA, every HIOA submodels will be executed at the next internal step so all of them must produce their outputs, otherwise only the submodel of next event will produce its output.
      java.lang.String select(java.lang.String[] candidates)
      when a coupled model is performing an internal step and more than one submodel tie for the next internal step, return the URI of the model that should do so, hence breaking the tie.
      void setImportedVariableValueReference(java.lang.String modelURI, java.lang.String sinkVariableName, java.lang.Class<?> sinkVariableType, Value<?> value)
      search among descendant HIOA of the model with URI modelURI all of the the atomic ones that use the designated variable or its aliases and set in them the reference to the placeholder for its value.
      void setSimulationRunParameters(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> simParams)
      set the simulation parameters for a simulation run.
      void showCurrentState(java.lang.String indent, Duration elapsedTime)
      show the current state of the model during the simulation.
      void showCurrentStateContent(java.lang.String indent, Duration elapsedTime)
      show the current state of the model during the simulation.
      Duration timeAdvance()
      return the time the simulated system remains in the current state before making a transition to the next sequential state; the method must be implemented by the user in each atomic model.
      boolean useFixpointInitialiseVariables()
      return true if the model uses the fixpoint algorithm to initialise its model variables, false otherwise; when true, the method fixpointInitialiseVariables must be implemented by the model, and when false, it is the method initialiseVariables that must be.
      void userDefinedExternalTransition(Duration elapsedTime)
      do an external transition using a previously stored external input event; this method is user-model-dependent hence must be implemented by the user for atomic models; the user implementation should not change any of the implementation related variables.
      void userDefinedInternalTransition(Duration elapsedTime)
      perform an internal transition; this method is user model-dependent hence must be implemented by the user for atomic models; the user implementation should not change any of the implementation related variables.

        imported - map from imported event types to submodels consuming them.

        connections - map connecting event sources to arrays of event sinks among submodels.

      • isCoordinated

        public boolean isCoordinated()
        Description copied from interface: ModelI
        return true if the simulation engine is coordinated by a parent.

        Description

        In DEVS, simulation can operate in different mode. The traditional mode confers to the coupled models and their coordination engine the role to pilot the advance of their submodels keeping a global synchronisation between the simulation clocks of their submodels. In real time, atomic models and their simulation engine operate on their own without being coordinated by parent coupled models and their coordination engines.

        This method allows to know when a model is coordinated and when it is not.

        Contract

         pre     true        // no precondition.
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Specified by:
        isCoordinated in interface ModelI
        Returns:
        true if the simulation engine is coordinated by a parent.
        See Also:
        ModelI.isCoordinated()

      • initialiseState

        public void initialiseState(Time initialTime)
        Description copied from interface: ModelI
        initialise the state of the model to make it ready to execute a simulation run.

        Description

        The standard predefined state initialisation will set the time to the next event. Hence, if a specific model has to perform some initialisations which the first internal transition depends upon, it must first perform them and then call the inherited method using super.

 pre     initialTime.greaterThanOrEqual(Time.zero(getSimulatedTimeUnit()))

        public void initialiseVariables()

      • fixpointInitialiseVariables

        public Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> fixpointInitialiseVariables()
        Description copied from interface: VariableInitialisationI
        initialise the model variables with a more elaborated protocol when external model variables depend of each others, hence models importing variables have to wait until these variables are themselves initialised so this protocol will allow to call repetitively the method until all variables are initialised without having to respect any order among models (but models cannot have circular dependencies); this method must be called after the method initialiseState.

        Contract

         pre     useFixpointInitialiseVariables()
 pre     allModelVariablesTimeInitialised()
 post    ret.getFirst() >= 0 && ret.getSecond() >= 0
 post    !(ret.getFirst() >= 0 || ret.getSecond() == 0) || allModelVariablesInitialised()
        Specified by:
        fixpointInitialiseVariables in interface VariableInitialisationI
        Returns:
        a pair which first element is the number of newly initialised variables (i.e.) and the second the number of non initialised yet variables.
        See Also:
        VariableInitialisationI.fixpointInitialiseVariables()

      • onceFixpointInitialiseVariables

        protected Pair<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Integer> onceFixpointInitialiseVariables()
        compute one run of the fixpoint algorithm to initialise the model variables.

        Contract

         pre     allModelVariablesTimeInitialised()
 pre     useFixpointInitialiseVariables()
 post    ret.getFirst() >= 0 && ret.getSecond() >= 0
 post    !(ret.getFirst() >= 0 || ret.getSecond() == 0) || allModelVariablesInitialised()
        Returns:
        a pair which first element is the number of newly initialised variables (i.e.) and the second the number of non initialised yet variables.

      • internalTransition

        public void internalTransition()
        Description copied from interface: ModelI
        perform the next internal transition, both calling the method userDefinedInternalTransition and doing all of the necessary internal catering work.

        Description

        In the standard DEVS protocol, this method is assumed to be defined by users in their atomic models. However, having only one method to do so makes it difficult to include common behaviours for models. Moreover, DEVS allows to define new types of models where specific common behaviours must be implemented. With the traditional DEVS vision, this would end up asking the users to cater for these common behaviours in each of their implementations the method, an error-prone burden put on their shoulders. In this library, we prefer to split transitions in two parts:

        • a library defined part, here internalTransition, which implementations in abstract classes include their common behaviours and, for atomic models, calls the user model specific part;
        • a user model-specific part, here userDefinedInternalTransition, which implements the execution internal events of the user-defined models per se.

        After the execution of the method, the relationships between timeAdvance, getTimeOfNextEvent, getNextTimeAdvance and getCurrentStateTime() is restored to reflect the wait for the next internal event.

        Contract

         pre     getTimeOfNextEvent().lessThan(Time.INFINITY)
 pre     getNextTimeAdvance().equals(getTimeOfNextEvent().subtract(getCurrentStateTime()))
 post    getTimeOfNextEvent().equals(Time.INFINITY) || getTimeOfNextEvent().subtract(getCurrentStateTime()).equals(getNextTimeAdvance())
        Specified by:
        internalTransition in interface ModelI
        See Also:
        ModelI.internalTransition()

      • userDefinedInternalTransition

        public void userDefinedInternalTransition(Duration elapsedTime)
        Description copied from interface: ModelI
        perform an internal transition; this method is user model-dependent hence must be implemented by the user for atomic models; the user implementation should not change any of the implementation related variables.

        Description

        The current simulation time when this method is called can be accessed by calling the method getCurrentStateTime.

        Contract

         pre     isInitialised()
 pre     getCurrentStateTime().equals(getTimeOfNextEvent())
 pre     elapsedTime != null
 pre     elapsedTime.lessThan(Duration.INFINITY)
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Specified by:
        userDefinedInternalTransition in interface ModelI
        Parameters:
        elapsedTime - time since the last event.
        See Also:
        ModelI.userDefinedInternalTransition(fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Duration)

      • select

        public java.lang.String select(java.lang.String[] candidates)
        when a coupled model is performing an internal step and more than one submodel tie for the next internal step, return the URI of the model that should do so, hence breaking the tie.

        Description

        Users must implement this method when their coupled models can exhibit such tied internal transitions, otherwise the default implementation performs a random selection.

        Contract

         pre     candidates != null && candidates.length > 1
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        candidates - URIs of the candidates submodels for the next internal transition.
        Returns:
        the URI of model that will perform its internal transition, breaking the tie.

      • externalTransition

        public void externalTransition(Duration elapsedTime)
        Description copied from interface: ModelI
        do the next external transition, both calling the method userDefinedExternalTransition and doing all of the necessary internal catering work.

        Description

        In the standard DEVS protocol, this method is assumed to be defined by users in their atomic models. However, having only one method to do so makes it difficult to include common behaviours for models. Moreover, DEVS allows to define new types of models where specific common behaviours must be implemented. With the traditional DEVS vision, this would end up asking the users to cater for these common behaviours in each of their implementations the method, an error-prone burden put on their shoulders. In this library, we prefer to split transitions in two parts:

        • a library defined part, here externalTransition, which implementations in abstract classes include their common behaviours and, for atomic models, calls the user model specific part;
        • a user model-specific part, here userDefinedExternalTransition, which implements the execution internal events of the user-defined models per se.

        After the execution of the method, the relationships between timeAdvance, getTimeOfNextEvent(), getNextTimeAdvance and getCurrentStateTime() is restored to reflect the wait for the next internal event.

        Contract

         pre     isInitialised()
 pre     elapsedTime != null
 pre     elapsedTime.lessThanOrEqual(getNextTimeAdvance())
 pre     getCurrentStateTime().lessThanOrEqual(getTimeOfNextEvent())
 post    getTimeOfNextEvent().equals(Time.INFINITY) || getTimeOfNextEvent().subtract(getCurrentStateTime()).equals(getNextTimeAdvance())
        Specified by:
        externalTransition in interface ModelI
        Parameters:
        elapsedTime - elapsed time since the last transition.
        See Also:
        externalTransition(fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.time.Duration)

      • userDefinedExternalTransition

        public void userDefinedExternalTransition(Duration elapsedTime)
        Description copied from interface: ModelI
        do an external transition using a previously stored external input event; this method is user-model-dependent hence must be implemented by the user for atomic models; the user implementation should not change any of the implementation related variables.

        Contract

 pre     elapsedTime != null
 pre     elapsedTime.lessThanOrEqual(getNextTimeAdvance())

        See Also:

      • modelContentAsString

        protected void modelContentAsString(java.lang.String indent,
                                    java.lang.StringBuffer sb)
        Description copied from class: Model
        produce a string representation the model content with the given indentation (perhaps with several lines) in the given string buffer.

        Contract

         pre     indent != null && sb != null
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Overrides:
        modelContentAsString in class Model
        Parameters:
        indent - indentation to be used when producing a new line.
        sb - string buffer to which the content must be added.
        See Also:
        Model.modelContentAsString(java.lang.String, java.lang.StringBuffer)
